direction.raw_text: - INT. APARTMENT - DAY The hallway is a mess. A window opening onto a light well is open. The door to the apartment is suddenly broken open. A plain- clothes detective, two uniformed police officers and several firemen - also in uniform - enter and look around. They all wear gloves and masks that cover their mouths and noses. Behind them, the superintendent and his wife also push their way in. They're both holding their noses. In his free hand, the superintendent holds a pile of mail and promotional flyers. Behind him, comes a female neighbor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to the superintendent and the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait Outside please. He signals to a police officer who herds the curious onlookers back out through the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to the superintendent, pointing to a pile of mail) What's the date of the last letter?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The 16th from what I can see... Wait... The plain-clothes detective has tried in vain to open the door on the left. It has been sealed up with adhesive tape.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to the fire officer) Can you try? While the firemen go to work on the door, the plain-clothes detective goes into the adjoining dining room. He opens the windows quickly and turns to go into the room to the left via the double doors. They are locked and the gaps are also taped up. He turns to the right and goes into the living room, where he also opens up the windows...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) The door is open. ...and comes back into the hallway, passing by the waiting firemen. Once again, we hear snatches of dialogue between the police officer and the janitor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...no as far as I know. During the whole time, they had a nurse, but it's been a while since I last saw her. My wife has been... The plain-clothes detective enters the bedroom which is now accessible. Its windows are open and the draft makes the curtains billow into the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to the firemen who are now curious enough to come and stand by the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you open the windows? The firemen shake their heads. The PLAIN-CLOTHES DETECTIVE turns toward the big double bed placed against the back wall of the bedroom. On the right- hand bed, there's only the bare mattress. On the left-hand bed lies the partly decomposed body of an old woman. Where once there were eyes, now there are only gaping holes. The corpse has been neatly dressed and is adorned with flowers that have already dried out a little. On her chest is a crucifix.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - White letters on a black background: THE CREDITS SCENE 3 - INT. CONCERT HALL - NIGHT All we see is the audience pouring into the hall. GEORGES and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: both are around eighty, are part of this crowd. They go to their seats in one of the rows near the front. Once everybody is seated, we hear the usual ANNOUNCEMENT asking people to turn off their mobile phones. Some people, caught with their phones switched on, hasten to comply. Then the lights go out. APPLAUSE. Off-screen, we hear the soloist make his entrance. THROATS ARE CLEARED here and there. Finally, the MUSIC begins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. ARTISTS DRESSING ROOM - NIGHT The music from Scene 3 continues. The soloist is surrounded by admirers who congratulate him. Now Georges and Anne push their way into the room. (If the soloist is female, they will be carrying flowers, like most of the others).
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . When the soloist notices their presence, he leaves his group of fans, heads towards them and greets them very warmly, visibly glad to see them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. BUS - NIGHT Continuation of the MUSIC from Scene 3. Georges and Anne are seated side by side in the half empty bus. Anne talks enthusiastically, Georges says something from time to time, and smiles now and then. They are both relaxed and happy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. APARTMENT - HALLWAY - NIGHT The door to the apartment is unlocked and opened from the outside. THE MUSIC ENDS. Georges comes in, turns on the light. He and Anne observe the open door. Around the lock, one can see the traces of an attempted forced entry. Georges bends down and runs his fingers over the deep grooves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They used a screwdriver or something like that...it doesn't look very professional...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But who would do something like that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No idea. Why do people break in? Because they want to steal something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (laughs briefly out loud) Hey, why not? If I thought about it, I could come up with at least three or four people we know who've been burgled. After having examined the outside of the second leaf of the double door, he comes in, closing the door behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What time is it? Can't we call the superintendent?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll do that tomorrow morning. Anyway, they didn't see anything. He unbuttons his overcoat and heads toward the large closet in the hallway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't let it spoil your good mood now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Or the police?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, give me your coat. She goes toward him, he takes her coat off and hangs it with his in the closet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Imagine if we were here, in our beds, and someone broke in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why should I imagine that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But it's terrible! I think I'd die of fright.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So would I. He undoes his shoes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shall we have a drink?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm tired.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I still fancy a drink. He puts away his shoes with the others and slips on his slippers. Anne has gone into the bathroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Go ahead then. Mathilde told me that in her building, the attic apartment was burgled from the loft. They just knocked a hole in the wall, cut out all of the valuable pictures from their frames and disappeared without a trace. He goes toward the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They must have been professionals. As he passes in front of the bathroom, he stops and appears to be looking at Anne.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did I tell you, you looked good tonight?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THEN:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) (FLATTERED) What's got into you? With a gentle LAUGH, Georges disappears into the kitchen, where he turns on the lights. We hear him FIDDLING AROUND, apparently getting a glass and some wine. After a short
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Weren't those semiquavers in the presto incredible? What staccato! Don't you agree? Short PAUSE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) You're proud of him, huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. BEDROOM - NIGHT Georges wakes up. He looks with amazement beside him, then raises his eyes. Anne is sitting upright, her back against the headboard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something wrong?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . After a while, the RINGING of a kitchen egg-timer leads us to the next scene.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. KITCHEN - DAY The egg timer in the kitchen RINGS. Georges is seated in front of the window, at a table which is half set for breakfast. He has mobile phone raised to his ear and a phone book opened in front of him. Anne is getting up from the table. She goes toward the stove, turns off the gas, takes the egg out of the pan with a spoon and runs it under cold water. Like Georges, she is still in her robe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (on the phone) What about next week? No but still, it would make sense to get it done soon. It might give people silly ideas. And anyway, it's too ugly to look at... Wednesday? What time?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Will you bring the paint with you too, to paint over it? But at least some primer...Yes, OK. Thank you. He hangs up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can depend on that guy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (who comes back to the table with the egg) I hope so. The last time, he kept us waiting for ages, if you remember.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (laughs while acquiescing) Yes, that's true. (Reacting when she places the egg in his egg cup) Thanks. If I call a regular professional, we'll still be waiting two months time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (more to herself) Really? She has sat down. Looks straight ahead. He cracks open his egg, puts salt on it, eats.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Frodons waited three days when their toilet was blocked. Not exactly pleasant. He eats. Wants to put on more salt, but the saltcellar is empty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The saltcellar is empty. He looks up for an instant, as if he expected her to deal with it. As she doesn't react, he realizes the inappropriateness of such an expectation, gets up himself, heads for the kitchen cupboards and fills the salt cellar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know if he's going to bring us the CD. Maybe he won't come at all. In any case, he didn't mention it. I'd like to buy it. It was really good and I don't want to wait long for it. We could go to Virgin this afternoon and buy it. What do you say? He comes back to the table and sits down again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hmmm? Anne? What's the matter? She looks at him and doesn't answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's going on? What's the matter? He waves his hand in front of her eyes and laughs nervously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Helllloooo!!! Cuckoo!!! I'm here! She continues to look at him without reacting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (serious now) Anne! What's going on? He waits, looks at her. No reaction. He stands up slightly, leans over the table to sit beside her. Tries to make her turn toward him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anne, what's the matter?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He manages to get her torso to turn halfway toward him, but her eyes look through him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anne...what's... He takes her face in both hands and turns toward him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anne... She stares into the void. He drops his hands. Then sits beside her, for quite awhile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finally he gets up, heads for the sink, turns on the tap, wets a tea towel, wrings it out a little, comes back and places it on Anne's face. Waits for a reaction that doesn't come. Then he pulls up her hair in the nape of her neck and applies the cloth there. Then sits down and looks at her imploringly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (close to tears) Anne...Darling...please! Once again they both remain seated. In the background, we hear the GUSHING of the tap that in his panic he has forgotten to turn it off. Making a sudden decision, he gets up, rapidly crossing the hallway, he goes into the bedroom where he starts to dress agitatedly, which takes him quite a lot of time. Suddenly, the GUSHING of the tap stops, which had accompanied us as far as the bedroom. George doesn't notice it immediately, then he stops short.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anne? Finally he returns, half dressed, into the kitchen. Anne is seated in the same place and looks at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing? She turns toward the breakfast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You left the water running.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Georges stares at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (both aghast and furious) Hey, what's going on? Are you completely crazy? Is this supposed to be a joke, or what's going on? She looks at him with amazement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did you say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this a joke? Is this meant to be a joke?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What joke? I don't get it! Why are you talking to me like that? What's got into you? Georges comes from the door to the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anne! Please! Stop this game. It's not funny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What game, for Christ's sake? What on earth's the matter?!! Georges is about to answer in a similarly irritated tone, but gradually begins to suspect that he could be mistaken. He tries to calm down, takes his chair that has remained beside Anne, sits down and looks at his wife. She doesn't know how to react.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the matter? Why didn't you react?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To what? To me, to everything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just now. A moment ago.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please tell me what's wrong. What am I supposed to have done? Georges first looks away reluctantly, then looks at Anne. He doesn't want to believe that its serious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know what to say. Do you really not know what just happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But what DID happen?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (almost reluctantly bowing his head as he speaks) You were sitting there, staring at me. You didn't answer me when I asked you what the matter was. He picks up the wet tea towel from the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I put this tea towel on your face, and you didn't react. Anne looks at the towel, then at Georges, and shakes her head, perturbed that she can't understand. Georges looks at her. He sees the damp marks on the collar of her robe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look... There's still dampness on your collar. Anne follows his gesture, tugs on her collar and sees the damp marks. She slowly grasps that something is awry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When... When was it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just now, a few minutes ago.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's no "So". I went into the bedroom to get dressed. I wanted to get help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Help?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, and then you turned off the tap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Because you left it on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't understand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neither do I.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you think it's best if I call Dr. Bertier?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why? What can he do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. Examine you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm fine. There's nothing wrong with me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anne, please!! That's absurd. We can't pretend that nothing happened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But what DID happen?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm here. I'm having my breakfast, and you're telling me things happened that I don't understand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you explain how the tea towel got there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I can't!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who turned on the tap?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You did!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you remember that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (more and more desperate, close to tears) No I can't! Do you want to torture me? Leave me in peace! Georges looks at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you think it would be better to fetch Dr. Bertier?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! She takes her cup of tea, as if to show how well she is, and drinks it up. When she wants to re-fill her cup, she completely misses her aim. She notices it, puts down her cup and bursts into tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. APARTMENT - NIGHT SILENCE We see wide shots of the apartment. The hallway. The bedroom. The living room. The dining room. The kitchen. Nobody in sight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. LIVING ROOM - DAY EVA, around 50, has come to pay a visit. Anne isn't there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know how he is. Once he's got something into his head, he has to go through with it. In the end, everybody was delighted. And besides, it didn't hurt our financial situation. We're playing until the 28th. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then we have 10 days to rest, then we go to Stockholm for four days, and then to Kumo in Finland. Heaven knows where that is. At the North Pole. But Geoff's already been there few times, and he loves it. We're playing the "Dowland Transcriptions" there and then we're back in London.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about the children?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Liz is at boarding school and John is living his own life. He's twenty- six years old.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What does he do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's a student. We rarely see him. He's got his own ideas. Life Geoff. They don't really get along. Geoff wants to advise him on everything, and John doesn't like that at all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is he good?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think so. He's less impulsive. Very industrious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That sounds rather derogatory.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No!! He's not like Geoff. Quiet, but stubborn. I think he'll do all right. At the last Conservatory concert, he played the solo part in the Haydn Concerto. It was very good. Geoff was there and congratulated him at the end. Brief PAUSE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you both make up?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (with a little laugh) My God, you know him, don't you? Over the winter, he suddenly discovered his passion for a viola player who'd been in our ensemble for years. What can I tell you? It was a huge drama, and the poor little darling wound up trying to commit suicide. That scared him and he came back to me in full remorse. I've got used to it now. What's a bit embarrassing is that the ensemble, you can't keep any secrets from anyone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you love him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I think so. Brief PAUSE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's aphasia? Georges gestures that it's too complicated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What can I say? The carotid artery was blocked. They did an ultrasound scan, two in fact, and they said they had to operate on her. She was scared. She was confused and scared. You know she has always been afraid of doctors. They said the risk was very low and that if they didn't operate, she'd be certain to have a serious stroke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what do they say now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just that it didn't go well. It's one of the 5% that go wrong. He yawns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's pretty upsetting. He looks at his watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Usually at this time, I take a nap. My blood sugar is somewhere down in my socks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm so sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What can I do for you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing. It was nice of you to come despite all of your stress. Brief PAUSE. She doesn't know what to say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, really. There's nothing you can do. We'll see how things go when she's back here in the apartment. We'll manage. Maybe I'll get a caretaker in, or maybe I'll manage on my own. We'll see. We've been through quite a lot in our time, your mother and I. (LITTLE LAUGH) All this is still a bit new.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (with a little laugh) It's funny. I don't know if I should say it. Maybe it'll embarrass you. But when I came here a short while ago, I suddenly remembered how I always used to listen to the two of you making love when I was little. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For me, at the time, it was reassuring. It gave me a feeling that you loved each other, and that we'd always be together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. BEDROOM - DAY A carpenter and his assistant are raising the base of the double bed. Georges watches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. HALLWAY - LIVING ROOM - DAY The door of the apartment is opened. Georges comes in. Behind him is Anne in a wheelchair, pushed by a paramedic. A second paramedic (as young as the first) follows with a suitcase and a large bag. Behind them, the superintendent. Georges tries to rid of the three as quickly as possible. He stuffs a twenty euro note into the hand of the first paramedic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here. Thank you very much. It's for both of you. You can just put the things down here. There, beside the window, right. We'll be okay on our own. Thanks a lot. The two paramedics exchange a brief glance, say thanks, and leave the apartment, passing the superintendent as they go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to the superintendent) Thank you, Mr. Mery.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you need anything, just call downstairs. If we can help at all...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right now everything's fine. I'll let your wife know as soon as we need anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's nice to have you back, Mrs. Laurent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Thank you, Mr. Mery. Thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The superintendent hesitates another moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes... So... Goodbye then, ma'am. Welcome home again. Goodbye, Sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goodbye, Mr. Mery.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goodbye. He leaves the apartment. There is a brief moment of perplexity. Then Georges says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (with a nervous smile) Where do you want...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the living room. Georges pushes her toward the living room door, walks around the wheelchair, opens the door, comes back behind the wheelchair and pushes Anne into the LIVING ROOM. The doorway is narrow. The wheelchair only just passes through it. Georges pushes Anne toward the sofa and the armchairs and then steps in front of her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shall I make some tea?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (with a faint smile) First come sit with me. George registers her smile; he knows he's behaving in a clumsy way. He sits down in one of the two arm chairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you help me into the chair? Georges stands back up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He extends his hands. She puts on the wheelchair brake, lifts the footrest with her left foot, raises her right leg from the footrest with her left hand and then extends her left arm to Georges.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's best if you put my arm around your neck and your right arm around me, that way it'll be easy. He does as he is told, pulls her up as they hobble together the short distance to the second arm chair. Cautiously, he lowers her down and helps her sit herself straight. Because they are not used to it, the whole process appears awkward and clumsy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks. He smiles because it seems silly to him to answer "Don't mention it". Then he sits down opposite her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . At first they are both ill at ease, but then they accept the fact that words do not come easily. After a long while, during which we hear the intermittent sound of the TRAFFIC below.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (softly almost to himself) I'm glad you're back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (in a voice just as soft) Me too. Another PAUSE. Then Anne says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Promise me one thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please never take me back to the hospital.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She looks at him. He has understood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You promise?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anne...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You promise?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anne, I...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't talk right now. And don't give me any lectures. Please. Brief PAUSE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What can I say, it's...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing. Just don't say anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. BEDROOM - NIGHT He helps her into bed, then throws the blanket over her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. Thank you, Darling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everything OK?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everything's fine. He hesitates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't have to hold my hand all the time now. I can look after myself, you know. He nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And don't feel guilty. That would be pointless. And a drag. For me too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't feel guilty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's good. She smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go over there now. I'm not a cripple. You can easily leave me alone for two minutes. I won't collapse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (with a slight smile)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you buy the new book on Harnoncourt?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've already read it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you want it? I'll get it for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. He goes out of the room to fetch the book. She remains lying there, waiting, and runs her healthy left hand through her hair to make herself look prettier, then smooths out the blanket that has slipped out of place a little. After a while, we hear Georges shouting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) I don't know where I put it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry. It isn't that important.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Yes, it is. Hold on, maybe it's in the... Just a moment! Viola! Here you are! Nothing like an infallible memory! She smiles, looks in his direction. He enters with the book in his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought I'd left it over there in the other room, but I'd already put it away. Tidy people just can't help being tidy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (taking the book) Thanks. She puts the book on her stomach. Looks at Georges.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right now, take care of yourself. And don't wait to see how I hold the book in my hand, OK?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He looks at her for a moment longer, then leaves the bedroom. She waits till he's outside. Tries to relax. Then she remembers the book. She takes it in her left hand and tries to open it. It's not easy for her. Then she notices that she's forgotten her glasses. She rests the book back on the bed cover and fishes for her glasses on the night stand. In the end, she manages it. Then she opens the book again, and tries to read.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. KITCHEN - DAY The superintendent's wife puts the filled supermarket bags on the counter. Takes the stack of mail that she had put on top of one of the bags and puts it down beside them. Then she takes out the receipt and the change.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unfortunately the strawberries were already moldy. I'll go and get you some fresh ones tomorrow from the market. My husband will bring you the bottled water this afternoon. I'm not supposed to carry anything heavy: my back, you know...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure, no problem.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It came to 76 euros and 40 cents. There's the till receipt and here's your change: 23 euros 60.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you very much. Keep the change. Thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, sir. Short embarrassed PAUSE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I'll be off. Call me if you need anything else.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. I will.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is your wife well? ...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, she's OK. She's recovering.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fine. Give her my regards. My husband and I are very glad she's back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, we are too. Bye, Mrs. Mery, thanks so much.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goodbye, sir. She heads toward the front door of the apartment, turns around again toward Georges.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll bring you the strawberries tomorrow around noon, if that suits you. He nods, she closes the door as she leaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. HALLWAY - TOILET - DAY He stands in front of the closed door of the toilet, waiting. After a while, we hear the noise of flushing. After a while longer, we hear
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) There. Can you come in, please? He opens the toilet door, goes around Anne, pulls her up, she puts her left arm around his neck, keeps herself upright that way, he pulls up her pants under her skirt. Then they slowly hobble out of the toilet and he sits her back down in the wheelchair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. BEDROOM - NIGHT They are both lying in their beds. Anne sleeps, BREATHING NOISILY. Georges lies with his eyes open, listening attentively to her breathing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. KITCHEN - DAY The sun shines in. Georges has cooked something simple. They are both in a good mood, eating and drinking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... some banal romance or other about a nobleman and a lower middle- class girl who couldn't have each other and who then, out of sheer magnanimity, decide to renounce their love - in fact I don't quite remember it any more. In any case, afterwards I was thoroughly distraught, and it took me a bit of time to calm down. In the courtyard of the house where grandma lived, there was a young guy at the window who asked me where I'd been. He was a couple of years older than me, a braggart who of course really impressed me. "To the movies", I said, because I was proud that my grandma had given me the money to go all alone to the cinema. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "What did you see?" I started to tell him the story of the movie, and as I did, all the emotion came back. I didn't want to cry in front of the boy, but it was impossible; there I was, crying out loud in the courtyard, and I told him the whole drama to the bitter end.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So? How did he react?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No idea. He probably found it amusing. I don't remember. I don't remember the film either. But I remember the feeling. That I was ashamed of crying, but that telling him the story made all my feelings and tears come back, almost more powerfully than when I was actually watching the film, and that I just couldn't stop. She looks at him, smiles, then turns back to her food.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's cute. Why didn't you ever tell me before?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are still a few stories you don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aha...? Don't tell me you're going to ruin your image in your old age?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You bet I won't. But what is my image? She takes a mouthful, eats ponderously. Then she looks at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sometimes you're a rotter. But you're nice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I take you for a drink?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. HALLWAY - DAY He does physiotherapy exercises with her. Counts the repetitive movements of the exercises.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. LIVING ROOM - DAY She's lying on the sofa. He's seated in the armchair. They're both reading the newspaper. After a while:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen to this! My horoscope. Motto: You have lots of verve, but need to be more serious! Love: High-class conversation is what you need. Work: You're motivated again. But proceed with care. Health: Loosen up by doing exercises. It'll give you renewed pizzazz.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Then
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've only yourself to blame if you read stuff like that. Brief PAUSE. Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tomorrow afternoon is Pierre's funeral.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have to go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I fear I must. I don't want to go at all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who does like going to funerals?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I know a few people who do. Annette can never wait to get all dolled up again. And Francois has...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're mean. What would you say if no one came to your funeral?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (dryly) Nothing, presumably. She shoots him a glance, smiles at his irony. Then she says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you talked to Jeanne since I was in the hospital? I mean, does she know I can't come?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did she say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She was shocked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a bit irritated) My God, what are people like when they're shocked? She couldn't believe it, she was speechless. I don't remember any more. In any case, not exactly. I've spoken to a lot of people since.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I'm sorry. I didn't mean to be unkind, but I just don't see the point of talking about it all the time. Short PAUSE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do I talk about it all the time?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. HALLWAY - LIVING ROOM - DAY The front door is unlocked from the outside, and Georges enters. He's back from the funeral, dressed for the occasion. He turns on the light. He's wet. Clearly, it's been raining. As he closes the door again, his eyes fall on Anne. With her back to him, she is sitting on the floor in front of the opened window of the light well, half propped against her wheelchair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What ... ?! Shaken, he heads toward her, picks her up and seats her in the wheelchair. Outside, in the light well, it is raining.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (once she's seated in the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why are you back already? What time is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Georges has understood immediately. He closes the window noiselessly. Then just stands there, at a loss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Then
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forgive me, I was too slow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anne...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you wheel me into the living room?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He turns toward her, pushes the wheelchair into the living room between the two armchairs. Turns on the light. Stops beside the switch. They both look exhausted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're always good at surprises.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Why are you home earlier?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't come home earlier. I took a taxi. In August, there isn't a lot of traffic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's true. How was the funeral?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anne...!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How was it, go on, tell me! He thinks an instant, then goes and sits down facing her in an armchair. Looks at her. She raises her head and returns his look. He understands that he can't insist right now. Long
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Then he begins:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was rather bizarre. The priest was an idiot. Then one of Pierre's co-workers made a speech that was embarrassingly emotional. His old secretary came with a radio- cassette player and after the speech she put on "Yesterday" by the Beatles. You can't imagine. Everybody turned round to look at her. Apparently, it wasn't planned. His grandchildren were there. Of course they giggled as soon as the music began. Then the urn was put on a huge stretcher that was obviously designed for a coffin, and out we went into the rain. They placed the urn on a small electric cart that crawled along for what seemed like an eternity to the tiny hole they had dug. A lot of people had to stifle their laughter. It must have been terrible for Jeanne. I have...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's just no point in going on living. I know it can only get worse. Why should I inflict it on us? On you and me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not inflicting anything on me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't have to lie, Georges.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Imagine you were me. Didn't you ever think something like this could happen to one of us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course I did. But imagination and reality have little in common.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But things are getting better every day. We'll...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Georges, I don't want to carry on. You're making such efforts to make everything easier for me. But I don't want to go on. For my own sake. Not yours.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't believe you. I know you. You think you're a burden on me. But what if things were the other way around? What would you do then?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. I can't be bothered to think about being you. I'm tired. You tire me. Everything tires me. I can't talk. I want to go to bed. He looks at her. Finally he gets up and pushes her wheelchair out of frame.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. BEDROOM - NIGHT 30. She is lying in bed. The bedside lamp is on. We hear the RADIO coming from the living room: a program about the fauna and flora of the South Seas, or something similar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. HALLWAY - LIVING ROOM - DAY Georges comes out of the kitchen and opens the front door. On the doorstep stands the soloist (male or female) from Scenes 3 and 4.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (somewhat perplexed, but pleased) Oh hello! Nice to see you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forgive me for dropping in on you like this, Professor. I tried to reach you by phone a couple of times, but no luck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry. I only pick up the phone when I've stored the caller's number and I can see who's calling. Why didn't you leave a message? Anyway, do come in... He closes the door behind his guest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just couldn't manage to come by after the concert. I was so sorry, because I was so pleased you came along.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come with me. While they pass into the living room, they continue to speak:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... And now, an unexpected opportunity has arisen because Francois Mitry called me - you know him, he's my agent - to say he'd arranged for me to meet the boss of the Theatre des Champs-Elysees tonight to talk about their new concert series. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So I flew to Paris this morning, and while I was in my hotel, I thought, I'll just give it a try and drop in. After all, it's virtually just around the corner. Sorry, these are for your wife. He takes the bouquet of flowers from its wrapping paper and hands it to Georges.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isn't she at home?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, she is. I'll go and get her in a minute. Have a seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hope I'm not disturbing you too much.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, not at all. I'm happy that you came. We were so thrilled by your concert. We hoped we'd see you again soon. Please do have a seat. Can I can get you something? A cup of tea?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no, thank you very much.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold on, I'll just freshen up the flowers; in this heat they wilt so fast...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've only just bought them. They should keep quite... But Georges has already left the room with the bouquet and closed the door behind him. The soloist looks around him. After a few moments we hear the VOICES of Anne and Georges in the distance, without understanding what they're saying. It lasts a while. Finally Georges opens the door and pushes Anne, in her wheelchair, into the living room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin! What a delight. How lovely to see you! The (male or female) soloist has got up and doesn't quite know how to handle the situation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mrs. Laurent! Lovely to see you too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't get up. Come on, sit yourself down and don't look so shocked. The soloist sits down hesitantly, Georges pushes the wheelchair between the two armchairs and also sits down. Brief embarrassed PAUSE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm so proud of you. We were both in raptures after your concert. Georges wanted to buy your new CD the very next morning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh God! I wanted to bring you the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: but I left in such a hurry that I forgot it. I'm so sorry. I'll get one today and drop it by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no, don't worry. We want to make a contribution to your success. Even if it's only twenty euros.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've already contributed so much. I owe you so much, Madame.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You owe it to your hard work and your talent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shaking his head a little) Do you remember, when you first gave me the Bagatelles to play? I was twelve at the time, and in my youthful arrogance I said: "But why the Bagatelles?" And you really gave me a piece of your mind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . They both smile. PAUSE. Then he goes on:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My right side is paralyzed, that's all. It can happen when you get older.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And how...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's talk about something else, shall we?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure ...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't be offended. But I want to enjoy the lovely interlude you've given us with your visit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course. Brief PAUSE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You haven't told us yet what's been going on since the Paris concert. The soloist is a bit thrown by the couple's behavior.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, actually I've spent most of the time in London studying. Then I went to Copenhagen for two performances, that was Schubert too. My whole life revolves around Schubert at the moment. The concerts with the Impromptus and the Moments Musicaux, and for my bread-and-butter work I'm developing the sonatas. Not the late ones, I think I still need a couple more years for those.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (The dialogue concerning music will be modified according to the performer chosen.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Could you do me a favor?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you play Fur Elise?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Um, I don't know if I remember it very well. Beethoven, it's been a long time since I've... But if you want...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give it a try.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: OK. He looks at Georges, then at Anne again, gets up, goes to the grand piano and plays.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. HALLWAY - DAY Georges is leaning against the chest, and watches Anne, who is practicing maneuvering her new electric wheelchair. Forward, backward, turning. In the end, she goes round and round in circles several times. He laughs, so does she.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. BEDROOM - LIVING ROOM - NIGHT Anne is lying in bed. A book rests on her stomach. She listens to the PIANO playing coming from the living room. After a while the music stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the matter?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Georges is seated in front of the open piano. His hands in his lap, he looks straight ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. LIVING ROOM - DAY 35. The superintendent's wife runs the vacuum cleaner over a carpet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. BATHROOM - NIGHT Anne is seated on a stool. Georges washes her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. KITCHEN - HALLWAY - BEDROOM - TWILIGHT Georges has cooked himself a steak and is eating. On the radio, we hear the EVENING NEWS. Suddenly, coming from the neighboring room, a LOUD CRASH and the SOUND of crockery breaking. Stifled CRY from Anne. Georges gets up, irritated, crosses the HALLWAY and enters the BEDROOM. Anne lies on the floor, beside the overturned night stand, in the midst of the crockery and remains of a meal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shocked, and hence furious) Good God, what are you doing? He hurries toward her and pulls her up rather roughly into the bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you lost your senses?! I don't believe it! How stupid! He points to the broken objects.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at that! Did you need to do that? Can't you call me when you need something?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (meekly) I'm sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, so am I.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry. Georges bends down, and begins to gather up the scattered objects.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The lamp is broken too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. BATHROOM - HALLWAY - ANNEX - DAY 36. Bathroom. Georges, in pajama pants, naked torso, brushes his teeth. The doorbell rings. Georges spits out, wipes his mouth, goes into the hallway and over to the front door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes? Who's there? No answer. Georges is very irritated. O.S., Anne calls to
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Georges? What's going on? Who is it? Georges opens the door. Outside, however, instead of the usual landing, we see an empty room lit a giorno but without a window, about as large as the rooms in the apartment. It looks like an unpainted room in a new apartment. A couple of ladders are propped against the opposite wall. At the other end of the room, to the side, is a small door. Georges is stunned, and doesn't understand what has happened. Hesitating, he crosses the room toward the door. O.S., in the distance, Anne's worried voice:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Georges? What's going on? Georges opens the small door. Behind it is a narrow, windowless corridor, as brightly lit as the room. At the end of the corridor, a door. Georges heads toward this door and opens it too. Behind it is a tiny windowless room, equally bright as the others. Everything is very quiet. Georges enters, turns round, then goes back along the corridor, crosses the room, comes through the apartment door into the hallway of the apartment. But it too is now empty and bright, with bare unpainted walls, no doors; only the door to the bedroom is open. Behind that too, it appears to be empty and bright. Georges goes toward it. At the same time, we hear GEORGES' VOICE. At first he groans, but then begins inarticulately hollering, louder and louder. Shortly after, we also hear:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Georges, what's going on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. BEDROOM - NIGHT Darkness. GEORGES HOLLERS 37.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Calm down will you! There's nothing there. It's nothing. She manages to switch on the bedside lamp. Georges is sitting up in his bed, having just awoken, wide-eyed with terror. His breathing is labored. Anne extends her good hand toward him, caresses his back to calm him. He slowly calms down and flops back on his pillow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was it? He doesn't answer. Continues breathing heavily. She caresses him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (still with labored breathing) I didn't understand... I thought I'd gone mad... It was something impossible...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. BEDROOM - DAY Close shot on the screen of a cell phone. We read on it: Coming to Paris on 12th. Plan to stop by in afternoon. Hope all well. So look forward to seeing you. Love Eva. We hear O.S. the voice of
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eva. They're coming on the 12th. He crouches down in front of Anne who is seated on the bed, puts his mobile phone back in his pocket and continues to put on her socks and her shoes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No idea. Apparently she's coming with Geoff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know exactly. What day is it today? I'll go and look. Short PAUSE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Geoff doesn't need to come.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Georges doesn't agree, but continues to dress Anne.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't need any comments on my predicament. I can only take his British humor in small doses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. HALLWAY - DAY Once more the set of physiotherapy exercises. Things are going better. Georges smiles encouragingly at Anne, noticing her improvement. She reacts like someone duty-bound, but without conviction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. LIVING ROOM - DAY Close shot: a CD is inserted into a player. As the MUSIC begins (the concert heard in Scene 3), Georges takes a card out of the envelope that contained the CD and reads it to
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dear Madame Laurent, Dear Monsieur Laurent, it was beautiful and yet sad to see you. My heartfelt wishes that things will get better. With deep gratitude, your former pupil, Martin. The MUSIC makes their SILENCE less awkward. Then, after a long while, Anne says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop the CD. He hesitates, looks at her, then stops the music. They remain
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . KITCHEN - ADJOINING ROOM - DAY They eat. Suddenly, Anne says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are the family albums?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The family albums? I don't know, there, in the other room. Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you get them for me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What, now? Anne nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why, Anne?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd like to look at them. Georges hesitates, and doesn't understand the suddenness of this request.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please! He finally gets up and goes into the adjoining room. He comes back after a few moments with a stack of albums, pushes away the remains of Anne's meal and sets down the first album in front of her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a bit irritated) You're welcome. With her able hand, Anne opens the album, looks at the photos, turns the pages, looks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's nice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (self-consciously, softly) What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Life...so long... What a long life... Georges looks at her. She continues to thumb through the pages. After a while she turns toward him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop watching me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (caught in the act) I wasn't watching you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course you were. I'm not that dumb yet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. BEDROOM - NIGHT They are both lying in bed. Georges reads the day's news to Anne from the newspaper. When he looks over to her, she has fallen asleep. He then puts the newspaper on the night stand and turns out the light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. BEDROOM - HALLWAY - BATHROOM - DAY Bedroom. It's morning. Georges is helping Anne to get out of bed into her wheelchair. As he does it, he notices that the bed and her nightgown are wet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're soaked through.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean? Brief PAUSE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold on. He sits her back on the bed and goes out of the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll be right back. During this time, she remains seated, feeling embarrassed, and waits. He comes back with a towel and puts it on the seat of the wheelchair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's no big deal. Come on. He lifts her out of the bed into the wheelchair and pushes her through the hallway into the bathroom. He lifts her out of the wheelchair, sits her on the stool and takes off her wet nightgown, pulling it over her head. She starts to SOB inconsolably. He caresses her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, darling. It's nothing serious. Things like that happen..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't... take it any more. He holds her tightly against him, strokes her hair, feeling helpless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My love. My darling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. BEDROOM - DAY Anne is in bed. She's on a drip. Eva is seated on a chair beside the bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... thinking about whether it wouldn't be better to invest the money in an apartment block. If inflation gets going again, property is the only sure thing. Right now, savings accounts pay
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .75% at best. Four years ago, Geoff bought some stocks with a small sum of money and the whole thing collapsed. So now we're obviously worried. Unfortunately, in the meantime, other people have had the same idea, and property prices are going through the roof. Since we came back from Scandinavia, I spend all my spare time looking through newspaper ads. To put an end to the PAUSE that follows, she adds:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It takes time, that's all. We'll find something in the end.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Another oppressive PAUSE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (slowly) Yes yes I have... I have... the grandmother... woman with house... not... the house then ... money
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't understand you, I'm afraid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... yes... now... it's all... house sel... sel... sel... was... in two strokes of... so quickly... god it's hard... to say... sell... money gone... left... there too...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Eva has tears in her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. LIVING ROOM - DAY Georges and Eva's husband, GEOFF, around fifty. He speaks with a British accent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... three times a week... I'm not experienced enough. We'll see if that's enough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much is she asking?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's paid by the hour. We'll see.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anne? Geoff nods. Georges shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's hard to say. Sometimes I get the feeling she's totally unaware of the state she's in. And then I feel the opposite. It's... I don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what about the doctor? What does he say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's... Eva comes in through the door. She's in floods of tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She only talks gibberish. I don't know what... Geoff gets up, hesitantly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, dear... He goes toward her and leads her to the armchair where he was sitting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...come here, sit down, it's OK. She shakes him off, irritated, and sits down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing is OK. At first he's vexed by her brusque response, but then goes to sit down on the sofa. Meanwhile, Eva turns to Georges:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's going on, actually? You can't just leave her lying on her bed like that! She's unrecognizable! It's ridiculous!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can't do anything for the moment. Calm down, darling. She's getting medical treatment, they give her the necessary medication, and there are no other options right now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What does that mean, "no other options"? Why isn't she in a hospital?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She had a second stroke. Bertier examined her and felt we could spare her all the hospital inpatient procedures. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anyway, they wouldn't keep her, they'd send her to a care home. What they do in those places, we can do here. Eva looks at him, amazed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And she won't be put in a care home. I promised her that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you think you're taking on too much?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you got a better idea? Geoff doesn't know what to say. Eva has composed herself somewhat and blows her nose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't believe that these days there's no way of handling this efficiently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No one's stopping you from finding out. Eva gets up, furious, and goes to the window. Georges follows her with his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Believe me, I love your mother as much as you do. So please, don't treat me as if I was a total idiot incapable of doing the obvious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't say that. I'm simply questioning whether what I see going on here is the answer to everything!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you want to get a second opinion?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now you two had better stop, OK? Another doctor did come. He said Bertier was right. From Monday, a nurse will come three times a week. Now can we talk about something else?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. KITCHEN - NIGHT Georges washes the tea cups that he used for Eva and Geoff. On the radio, the EVENING NEWS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. BEDROOM - DAY With expert gestures, a nurse shows Georges how to lie Anne down and put an incontinence pad on her. She's now almost incapable of moving, and has to be turned over like an object, as tears flow silently down her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. LIVING ROOM -DAY Anne is at the piano and plays the piece from the Scene 3. We watch her and listen to her for a while. Georges is seated in his armchair and looks at the piano. Finally he leans over toward the CD player and stops it. The
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: suddenly stops. Georges remains silently seated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. KITCHEN - HALLWAY - BEDROOM - DAY He prepares a bowl of muesli, fills a sipping cup with water and brings both into the bedroom. Sits down on the bed close to Anne to feed her her food.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There, my love, I hope you like it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... He begins to feed her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I added a little orange juice. I find it tastes quite good. She can only swallow slowly, and so something keeps running back out of her mouth. He wipes it with a tea towel, continues to feed her. Finally, after a few mouthfuls, she keeps her mouth shut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, Anne, you have to eat some more. You've only swallowed three mouthfuls. Anne continues to keep her lips sealed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, darling. A bit more. Anne doesn't move. He puts the muesli on the night stand and holds the sipping cup to her lips. She drinks slowly, one sip after the other. He pulls the cup back between each sip, to give her more time. Suddenly she says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Mom to the concert...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Mom to the concert... no dress...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mom has no dress for the concert?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Mom to concert... no ... uuu... no...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes? Long PAUSE. Georges waits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. BATHROOM - DAY Georges and the nurse install Anne on a metal armchair in the shower. As she does so, the nurse keeps talking reassuringly to Anne. Finally, she turns on the tap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (in a monotone) Help! Help! Help! Help! Help! Help!... Without being phased, the nurse continues to speak reassuringly. Georges remains standing there, helpless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. KITCHEN - HALLWAY - BEDROOM - DAY 47. Kitchen. Georges and the nurse are seated at the table with a cup of coffee. In front of the nurse, on the table, is a sum of money. As they speak, we hear, coming from the room, Anne's
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... we could take turns. She'd come from 8 till 12 and I'd do 2 until
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: or 3 to 7. That would certainly relieve the pressure on you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll think about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She just has to know in time so she can arrange it in her schedule.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, of course, I'll let you know in the next few days.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very well. I have to go now... She takes the money on the table, pockets it and gets up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks for the coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My pleasure. I'll see you out. They both leave the kitchen. As the nurse, in the hallway, takes her jacket off the hook in the closet and puts it on, she comments on Anne's continuing CALLS FOR HELP.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mustn't take it too seriously. Usually they always say something. She might just as well say "Mom, Mom, Mom". It's just mechanical.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (nodding, softly) I know. They've reached the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goodbye, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goodbye. He closes the door behind her. Remains motionless a moment, then goes into the bedroom, where Anne's CALLS FOR HELP, unaltered, continue. Georges sits down beside Anne on the bed, takes her hand, holds her. After a while, Anne calms down, her CALLS FOR HELP become quieter and finally stop altogether. After a long PAUSE:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (slowly, softly) I'd like to hire a second nurse. The two could take turns. That would make everything a bit simpler. What do you think? Long PAUSE. Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (softly) ...Help...Help...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. BEDROOM - NIGHT They are both lying in bed. Georges SNORES noisily. Anne's eyes are open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. HALLWAY - KITCHEN - DAY The front door. We hear the key in the lock. Georges enters with a shopping bag, and behind him is the superintendent. He carries bigger and heavier bags. Georges holds the door open for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you mind putting them in the kitchen. The superintendent precedes him into the kitchen with the bags. Georges calls toward the bedroom:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm ba-aack! He then follows the superintendent into the kitchen. The superintendent has put the bags on the work surface.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks very much.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I do anything else for you, sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, thanks, Mr. Mery. You've been a big help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, it's nothing, sir. Georges has already taken out his wallet and gives some money to the superintendent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks a lot, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll let you know if I need you again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With pleasure, sir. He gets ready to leave. He stops again in the doorway and turns around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: May I say something, sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My wife and I, we're very impressed by the way you're managing everything. I take my hat off to you. As he speaks, Georges' mobile phone has started to ring.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (taking the mobile phone from the pocket of his jacket) That's very kind of you. Thanks. See you soon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give my regards to your wife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I certainly will. Thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . As the superintendent leaves the apartment, Georges looks at the display on his mobile phone and makes a call.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello Eva, how are you?... Things are fine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. BEDROOM - DAY Georges, standing at the foot of the bed, faces Anne and starts singing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (insistently)...Sur le pont ...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Ssssur...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Sur le pont...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: po ... pont ... sss
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Sur le pont ... Sur le pont ...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Ssssur le pont ...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smiling to encourage her): ... Sur le pont d'Avignon...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... ssur... le ..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... pont... Sur le pont d'Avignon... (he begins to sing): Sur le pont d'Avignon on y danse, on y danse, sur le pont d'Avignon tout le monde y danse en rond... He encourages her to sing with him. Starts singing again:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sur le pont d' Avignon, on y danse, on y danse ... Anne tries to sing too, she has a hint of a smile on her face, but she produces only isolated SOUNDS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (singing to encourage Anne, accompanied by the sounds that she produces): Sur le pont d'Avignon on y danse, on y danse ... Sur le pont d'Avignon tout le monde y danse en rond ...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. BEDROOM - DAY A second nurse is doing Anne's hair roughly. The brush sticks in her tangled hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... there we are...now we're all beautiful again...so everybody will admire us...there...you see... wait... She takes a mirror that she has placed within reach. Holds it in front of Anne's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well?... What do we say to that? Aren't we a pretty sight? Anne, sickened, averts her eyes. Emits a muffled SOUND. The nurse ignores it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll see, Monsieur will be dazzled by you... Furious SOUND from Anne.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. HALLWAY - NIGHT The window opening onto the light well is open. A pigeon has landed on the window ledge. It walks to and fro, then finally dares to jump down inside, onto the floor. It starts to explore the surroundings. We hear the TOILET FLUSH. Georges comes out of the toilet. The door opening frightens the pigeon. Alarmed, flapping its wings, it flutters about the room. After a moment of surprise, Georges tries to shoo it back toward the window. But the bird escapes in the opposite direction. George follows it. He closes the doors of the other rooms. Coming from the bedroom, we faintly hear ANNE'S VOICE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Georges fetches a towel from the bathroom. He chases the bird. He hits out at the bird for so long that it escapes back out through the window. Georges, visibly exhausted, has to sit down on the chest in the hallway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. LIVING ROOM - DAY Georges and the second nurse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... as you wish, sir. I don't know what you were expecting. I gave up another job to come and work here. You should have thought it over before deciding whether you wanted a second nurse or not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I've only just found out how incompetent you are.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that supposed to mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want to discuss it with you. Anyway, you wouldn't understand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No one has ever complained.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good for you. (To get rid of her) How much do I owe you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (after a brief calculation) Seven hundred and eighty euros. Georges takes his wallet from his jacket hanging on the armchair and takes out eight one-hundred euro bills. The nurse is hopping mad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've never had anything like this happen to me before. Who do you think you are?! I've been doing this job for ten years. I don't need you to teach me how to do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you have twenty euros?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The nurse takes out her purse angrily, looks inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then take the eight hundred euros. You can go now. The nurse pockets the money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a nasty old man. I feel sorry for you. Georges has put back his wallet, turns to her again and looks at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hope from the bottom of my heart that one day someone treats you the way you treat your patients, and that you too will have no way of defending yourself. Now get out. She looks at him, at first doesn't know what to answer, then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go fuck yourself, you old fart! She leaves, slamming the door behind her. A few seconds later, we hear the front door of the apartment fall shut. Georges sits down in his armchair, looks straight ahead. Then he lights a cigarette, his hands shake, he smokes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. BEDROOM - NIGHT He tries to pour some tea into her mouth with the sipping cup. She won't loosen her lips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Please, open your mouth... go on... open it... Anne! Please!... come on... stop that!... He sits upright.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you don't drink, you'll die. Indecipherable SOUND from ANNE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that what you want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She looks at him. He bends over her again, presents the cup in front of her sealed lips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, Anne, please. She doesn't react. He opens her lips with his fingers and tries carefully, but using some force, to separate her teeth. Pours a little tea in. The liquid runs out of her mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goddammit! He puts down the cup, takes a towel and wipes the liquid, some of which has run down onto the pillow. He tries to mop it up. She watches him the whole time. Finally he puts the towel down beside the cup and looks at her. Tries not to show his helplessness and his anger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anne! ... You can't force me to let you die of thirst. If you persist, I'll call Bertier and he'll put you in hospital. They can force-feed you there. Is that what you want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I promised to spare you that. But you must help me. I'm out of my depth. He takes the cup again and puts it against her lips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, Anne! Her lips remain sealed. He presses the cup hard against them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Drink that, now! It hurts her, so she opens her mouth and lets in a little liquid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There! She closes her mouth again and he puts down the cup.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good. Then she spits it all out like a fountain. After a moment of bewilderment, he slaps her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He's frightened by his own gesture. Then he puts down the cup and sits on the chair beside the bed. They don't look at each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Help... help...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, forgive me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (softly) Help... Help... Help... Help...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. APARTMENT - DAY The various paintings hanging in the apartment. Without their frames. Like views on various realities.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Sometimes, the REMOTE sound of TRAFFIC in the distance.
direction.name: direction
